channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

item.title: Report X-2023120497
item.description:
Report X-2023120497

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/5/2023 at approximately 1326, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the staion location in Miami, reporting an hazardous spill . The shipment consists of a one fiberboard box classified as UN 3373, in which the inner container leaked due to a loose screw-on top. The shipment suffered total loss and the shipper has been notified. In compliance with 49 CFR 171.15, this incident was reported to the National Response Center and filed under report # 1385950.

item.title: Report X-2023120449
item.description:
Report X-2023120449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the HazMat Cage in a red tote and HazMat bag. Someone had already put it there. DescribePack: The bottom of the box was damp and torn open. The metal jerrican was badly dented on the bottom and had a pinpoint hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Someone moved the HazMat into the HazMat Cage with a red tote and HazMat bag.

DescribePack: One loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a double lined hazmat bin and put in a well ventilated area

item.title: Report X-2023120435
item.description:
Report X-2023120435

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet after being put into overhead sortation and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One of the jerricans in the box was leaking contents from under the cap, even though the cap was on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120421
item.description:
Report X-2023120421

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: OCALA

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 plastic pail of Solvent Direct hydrogen peroxide 35% 5-gallon had loose & broken lid resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Plastic pail had loose & broken lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120413
item.description:
Report X-2023120413

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A tugger was pulling this open hazmat off the NC belt when he felt liquid coming from the box. He moved the package to a safe position away from everybody else in a red tote. DescribePack: Glass cap broke off, but was not in the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moving the package to a safe area to not affect anyone's safety and telling the QA manager as soon as he could.

item.title: Report X-2023120461
item.description:
Report X-2023120461

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from truck when employee noticed box was wet. The box was immediately placed in Hazmat bag and container then processed. DescribePack: Lids on jugs of Hazmat product were not secure and liquid came out during the transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was immediately placed in Hazmat bag and container then processed.

item.title: Report X-2023120459
item.description:
Report X-2023120459

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found stained in black paint. Upon inspection found a box of Precision Color black paint aerosols 12-oz damaged. 4 aerosols had small dent & hole at bottom of cans resulted to leakage & stained contents. Due to leakage, another box for 12 preicsion color linen aerosols that were stained. Outer box didn't display another hazmat or limited quantity but small boxes inside had limited quantity diamonds. DescribePack: Aerosol cans had small dent & hole at bottom of can resulted to leakage & stained contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120450
item.description:
Report X-2023120450

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: WEST PALM BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120450 SequenceEvent: I noticed the Hazmat package had been removed from the conveyor belt and placed inside a Hazmat plastic container, before being processed. DescribePack: The pkg. failure occurred when the cap wasn't properly closed. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed inside of a plastic container. 2. X-2023120456 SequenceEvent: THIS MORNING I FOUND THIS HAZMAT PKG IN MY WORK AREA. DURING FURTHER INVESTIGATION I DISCOVERED THIS PKG WAS A HAZMAT AND WAS MAY HAVE BEEN REPACKED THE NIGHT BEFORE. HAZMAT WAS WRAPPED IN FEDEX PLASTIC BAGS. ONLY FOUND 3 SUPER TRUMP BOTTLES. ONE WAS COMPLETELY EMPTY, CONTENTS HAD SPILLED INSIDE PACKAGING. NO OTHER DAMAGES FOUND. DescribePack: Package had loose caps and no internal partitions. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a Hazmat bin to keep away from other packages and PH

item.title: Report X-2023120500
item.description:
Report X-2023120500

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Nov 27th during the PM sort a package was discovered leaking. It was marked as containing UN3267, Corrosive liquid, basic, organic, n.o.s, 8, II. Since it was visibly leaking and had a strong odor, the package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted to pick up. It was not opened up to determine what the inner packagings were.

item.title: Report X-2023120176
item.description:
Report X-2023120176

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA attention due to not being processed hazmat. upon arrival package was placed on the ground sideways not right side up. upon moving the package, leakage was discovered on the outer box. Package was taken to QA Hazmat cage in red tote with bag for damage processing. DescribePack: Plastic Pail/bucket Leaking due to Loose cap around the main sealed lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into red hazmat tote to prevent further leakage

item.title: Report X-2023120155
item.description:
Report X-2023120155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Ecolab Pinnacle Intensive Tile Cleaner leaked from loose caps. About 10 ounces were released. The bottles have a seal but the caps were not secured. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023120133
item.description:
Report X-2023120133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received wet off trailer 819955, out of 303-ATL.; pkg. laying on its side Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that both containers had lose caps, causing about 12 oz. to leak out. There were no material inside to protect the containers, orientation arrows on side of box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. is in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived to the van line via tuggar, package was then placed inside of the hazmat bin when leakage was detected. DescribePack: The cap on 2 bottles were loose, causing the liquid to spill into the plastic bag, there was so much liquid that it seeped into the seams of the bag and leaked onto the box. DurationRel: 30 and MitigateEffect: The entire box was placed inside of a red tote for hazmats including a haz mat bag.

UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE METAL CAN INSIDE THE BOX WAS DENTED, CAUSING LIQUID TO SPILL OUT. DescribePack: CAN WAS DENTED NEAR TOP CAUSING CLOSURE TO LOOSEN AND LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX AND CONTENTS PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND SALVAGE DRUM

item.title: Report X-2023111311
item.description:
Report X-2023111311

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS LOCATED NEAR LOADING BAY 1 LEAKING; THE PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE AREA AND HANDLED IN THE DMP AREA. THE ITEM INSIDE CONTAINS A METAL BUCKET HAVING A DIAMOND HAZARDOUS LABEL FLAMMABLE LIQUID CLASS 3 UN1993. THE BUCKET APPEARED TO BE USED WITH THE METAL LID TO BE CORRODE AND BENT INWARD. THE LIQUID IN THE TRAILER WAS ABOSRB TO THE BEST OF ITS ABILTY BUT THE SOME SOAKED INTO THE WOODEN FLOORING, AND MANGAMENT DELT WITH TRAILER LOADING PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023110422
item.description:
Report X-2023110422

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/23/2023 at approxiamtely 1659, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the ramp facility in Miami, reporting a UN 3373 spill. The shipment consisted an estimated ten specimens packaged in a fiberbaord box labeled as "UN 3373". One of the specimen was contained in a plastic jar with a screw-on lid. The lid on the jar was discovered loose and the liquid containing animal tissue spilled. The lid was secured back onto the container and the shipment is being held for customer pick-up. Per policy, the shipment was reported to the the National Response Center.

item.title: Report I-2023090165
item.description:
Report I-2023090165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0815 EDT the captain on inbound flight FFT1167 was taxing into gate 15 at Orlando International Airport (MCO) and called Ops and stated, "we have a fire". Ops notified the Comm Center and the airport fire department, which met the aircraft at the gate. We got the approval to pull the bridge up to the aircraft as it was advised the fire was out. The fire department entered the aircraft and determined it was safe to deplane the passengers. A woman, seated in row 7, tote bag began to smoke and catch on fire. The tote bag had a vape pen, a loose spare battery and a laptop in the tote bag. The flight attendants were quick to respond with a fire extinguisher and a fire containment bag and were able to put the fire out as fast as possible by using the fire containment bag to place the tote bag in it to stop the fire. The tote bag sustained heavy damage. Determined the tote bag contained a vape pen, a loose spare battery, and a laptop. Unsure if the vape pen or the loose battery began the thermal runaway as both were heavily damaged. The laptop was in the early stages of melting. There was no damage to the aircraft nor injured passengers on board. The fire department collected the fire containment bag with the tote bag in it. The passenger did eventually collect her laptop that was in the bag after speaking with the fire department and Frontier security.
